name: Cardio
description: Exercises that increase heart rate and improve cardiovascular endurance, such as running, cycling, and jumping rope.

name: Strength Training
description: Focuses on building muscular strength and power through resistance-based movements like squats, deadlifts, and presses.

name: Flexibility
description: Aims to improve the range of motion in muscles and joints through stretching exercises and mobility work.

name: Balance
description: Exercises that enhance body stability and coordination, often involving core engagement and single-leg movements.

name: HIIT
description: High-Intensity Interval Training that alternates short bursts of intense activity with periods of rest or lower-intensity work.

name: Core
description: Targets the abdominal and lower back muscles, improving posture, stability, and overall body control.

name: Bodyweight
description: Utilizes the body’s own weight as resistance, including exercises like push-ups, pull-ups, and planks.

name: Plyometrics
description: Explosive movements like jumps and bounds to build speed, power, and neuromuscular coordination.

name: Powerlifting
description: Training focused on maximal strength in compound lifts such as squat, bench press, and deadlift.

name: Olympic Lifting
description: Involves technical lifts like snatches and clean and jerks to build explosive strength and coordination.

name: Aerobics
description: Rhythmic, dance-like routines set to music that improve cardiovascular fitness and endurance.

name: Endurance
description: Enhances the ability to sustain physical activity over extended periods, often through repetitive low-intensity work.

name: Agility
description: Exercises that improve quickness, change of direction, and reaction time, useful in many sports and functional training.

name: Functional Training
description: Mimics real-life movements to improve everyday performance, stability, and injury prevention.

name: Stretching
description: Dedicated routines that target muscle lengthening, relaxation, and recovery post-exercise or for mobility.
